content:
Below a video news that the Chinese Consulate General in Los Angeles reminded Chinese in the United States to "register as overseas citizens" on January 15.
Netizens joked, "It turns out that the overseas underground police stations are real" and "Are you going to recruit overseas grid workers?"

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
"Language Art"
On January 15, China Business News and Singapore media Lianhe Zaobao both wrote a news article about today's survey of the China-Japan Chamber of Commerce, but the reports of the two media were completely opposite.
Lianhe Zaobao reported that most companies in China invested less or no money in China last year compared with the previous year, and only 15% of companies increased their investment.
China Business News reported that more than half of Japanese companies in China invested more in China last year.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Statistics from the National Bureau of Statistics show that there are 200 million people in flexible employment across the country. The most commonly offered salary level is 10,001 to 15,000 yuan, accounting for 30.3%, while traditional employment that offers the same salary level accounts for only 20.2%. Flexible employment mainly includes part-time work, outsourcing, labor cooperation, short-term contracts, self-cooperation, and labor dispatch. According to the Employment Department of the National Development and Reform Commission, flexible employment personnel mainly include: self-employed personnel, part-time employees, online retail, mobile travel, online education and training, Internet medical care, online entertainment, express delivery, online meal delivery and other new employment forms.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Migrant workers are the majority of flexible employment practitioners
 As far as food delivery riders are concerned, taking Meituan as an example, a total of 6.24 million riders earned income through the two platforms in 2022, an increase of 18.4% from the previous year. The growth is even more obvious for flash delivery riders. As of the end of 2022, the number of licensed flash delivery riders in Dada will exceed 2 million, a significant increase compared with 700,000 in the previous year.
 In addition, couriers may account for at least 10 million people. â€¦

content: The National Bureau of Statistics said that the average weekly working hours of employees in enterprises across the country is 49 hours.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Market response: On January 17, after the National Bureau of Statistics released a series of stable and positive data, more than 5,000 A-share stocks fell.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
On January 17, more than 100 suppliers of Hunan Bubugao Supermarket gathered in front of the Hunan Provincial Government Petition Bureau to demand payment for their goods. Bubugao Supermarket is currently in the stage of state-owned asset restructuring in Xiangtan.
It is reported that the special police arrested most of the people at the scene and took them to a diversion center on buses.

content: On January 17, some parents hung a white banner in front of the gate of Guangdong Zhanjiang University of Science and Technology, demanding justice for their child's death, which was suspected to have been caused by campus bullying.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: A Xiaohongshu user posted that he was threatened by a school leader to delete his post in a private message, otherwise he would bear the consequences.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
January 16, Bijie, Guizhou. The Qingshuipu Sales Department of Bijie Rural Consumer Cooperative was smashed by the people because they could not withdraw their deposits.
In the video, you can see that the hall of the sales department was smashed into a mess.
On January 17, the staff of the Qingshuipu Police Station responded that they knew about the incident and the people had come to the police station to register the amount of their deposits.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: January 16, Dongguan, Guangdong. Jierong Technology will implement a rotational holiday for all employees. Some employees received a notice that they were "given a 6-month holiday", which caused a lot of dissatisfaction among the workers. According to photos and videos circulated online, some employees held banners outside the factory gate saying "Jierong forced us to take a 6-month long holiday, stopped our cards and access control and refused to let us enter the factory, and wanted to buy out our seniority for 0 yuan", and some employees climbed to the roof and wanted to jump off the building to defend their rights.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: On January 16, in Wuji County, Shijiazhuang, Hebei Province, a netizen posted a video saying that a tobacco and alcohol shop was robbed and the owner was stabbed in the neck and sent to the hospital by 120.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Subsequently, the Wuji County Public Security Bureau issued a notice stating that the suspect had been arrested and the injured had been sent to the hospital for treatment and were not in danger of life.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: January 16, Xining, Qinghai. The Shengjin Huating Phase II construction project has been in arrears of wages for three years. Workers are holding banners outside the sales department to demand their wages.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: However, in the comments section below the National Bureau of Statisticsâ€™ statement that the national average weekly working hours are 49 hours, people have said that their working hours far exceed 49 hours.

content:
On January 17, a certain place in Shanxi Province issued a notice to survey parents of active military personnel who were on overseas missions or guarding the border.
A certain place in Jilin Province collected statistics on teachers and students who went to Taiwan for exchanges within the past five years.

content: On January 17, under a news report that China's GDP would grow by 5.2% year-on-year in 2023, nearly 90,000 comments collectively sarcastically joined the official in making false claims.
